zone.line: in whatever bower he sat expecting the
moment of our union, that his daugh
ter was come. Then the mark of
misery would have faded from my
forehead brow, and I should raise my
eyes fearlessly to meet his, which ever
beamed with the soft lustre of innocent
love. When I reflected on the magic
look of those deep eyes I wept, but
gently, lest my sobs should disturb the
fairy scene.
I was so entirely wrapt in this
reverie that I wandered on, taking
no heed of my steps until I actually
stooped down to gather a flow flower
for my wreath on that bleak plain
where no flower grew, when I awoke
from my day dream and found myself
I knew not where.
The sun had set and the
roseate hue which the clouds had
caught from him in his descent had
nearly died away. A wind spept swept across
